# Collapsible Sections

This article demonstrates the details and summary elements that should be preserved as inline HTML in the Markdown output.

<details><summary>Click to expand this section</summary><p>This is the hidden content inside the details element. It contains a paragraph of text that is revealed when the user clicks the summary.</p></details>

Some content between collapsible sections.

<details open=""><summary>This section starts open</summary><p>This details element has the open attribute, so it is expanded by default.</p><ul><li>It can contain lists</li><li>And other block elements</li></ul></details>

Details elements are commonly used for FAQs and progressive disclosure patterns. This paragraph provides enough content for Readability to recognize the article.

<details><summary>Frequently Asked Question</summary><p>The answer to the question goes here. This pattern is used on many documentation and FAQ pages.</p></details>
